definition: of a good enough standard or quality
honest and fair; treating people with respect
acceptable to people in a particular situation
wearing enough clothes to allow somebody to see you
to do what people or society expect, especially in a difficult situation
a long piece of wood that is fastened across the necks of two animals, especially oxen, so that they can pull heavy loads
rough treatment or something that limits your freedom and makes your life very difficult to bear
a piece of wood that is shaped to fit across a person’s shoulders so that they can carry two equal loads
a part of a dress, skirt, etc. that fits around the shoulders or hips and from which the rest of the cloth hangs
an animal from southern Africa that has a long nose and tongue and that eats insects
a small animal that has four webbed feet (= with skin between the toes), a tail and thick brown fur. Otters live in rivers and eat fish.
a state, society or group governed by old people; government by old people
the process of improving an area of a town or city so that it attracts people of a higher social class than before
the process of improving somebody's manners, a way of life or an activity so they become acceptable to people of a higher social class than before
a person who plays a musical instrument
the act of deliberately making somebody believe something that is not true (= of deceiving them)
a trick intended to make somebody believe something that is not true
likely to make you believe something that is not true
the habit of eating and drinking too much
unhappy or disappointed because of something unpleasant that has happened
an illness in the stomach that makes you feel sick (= want to vomit) or have diarrhoea
obvious and definite
having very strong opinions
based on or counted in tens or tenths
to say something loudly; to speak loudly and with force about something you feel strongly about, especially in public
a passage between rows of seats in a theatre, an aircraft, etc.
a bridge placed between the side of a ship and land so people can get on and off
a feeling of anger or dislike towards somebody because of something bad they have done to you in the past
a piece of meat or fish that has no bones in it
the act of speaking or of expressing something to an audience in a formal way
a speech or piece of writing that strongly expresses feelings and opinions
a strong closed container, used for processes that involve high temperatures or pressure
decorated in a way that makes it attractive; intended to look attractive or pretty
a mountain goat with long curved horns
a person whose job is painting the inside walls of buildings and putting up wallpaper
a person whose job is designing the inside of houses by choosing colours, carpets, furniture, etc; an interior decorator
to turn into gas; to make something turn into gas
an act of breathing out the air or smoke that is in your lungs; an amount of air or smoke that you breathe out
a simple type of sugar that is an important energy source in living things and that is a part of many carbohydrates
a stone that is put on a grave, showing the name, etc. of the person buried there
a piece of stone placed at one end of a grave (= where a dead person is buried), showing the name, etc. of the person buried there
a large, flat stone that lies over a grave (= where a dead person is buried) or stands at one end, that shows the name, age, etc. of the person buried there
a wild bush with thorns on which blackberries grow
a small soft black fruit that grows on a bush with thorns in gardens or in the countryside. The bush is also called a blackberry.
that can be taken away from an amount of money you earn, from tax, etc.
using knowledge about things that are generally true in order to think about and understand particular situations or problems
to refuse to let somebody be a member of a social group; to refuse to meet or talk to somebody
to damage the appearance of something especially by drawing or writing on it
a mark on the skin or on an object that makes it look less beautiful or perfect
the act of damaging somebody’s reputation by saying or writing bad or false things about them
a false spoken statement intended to damage the good opinion people have of somebody; the legal offence of making this kind of statement
showing a critical attitude and lack of respect for somebody
the feelings and activities connected with a person’s sexual desires
all through a period of time
at some point in a period of time
during the time that something is happening; at the same time as something else is happening
used to contrast two things
although; despite the fact that…
to harm somebody by saying or writing bad or false things about them
intended to harm somebody by saying or writing bad or false things about them
causing or likely to cause harm or damage
unpleasant and unfair; likely to offend somebody or make them jealous
expressing severe criticism of somebody
if a part of your body is numb, you cannot feel anything in it, for example because of cold
unable to feel, think or react in the normal way
to make somebody unable to hear, either permanently or for a short time
wearing make-up
not true or real; invented
the attitude of expecting not to succeed, and showing it in a particular situation
a special ceremony at which a new public official or leader is introduced or a building or organization is officially opened
the introduction of a new development or an important change
the tube in the body that carries air from the throat to the lungs
the tube in the body that carries air from the throat to the lungs
solid waste material that leaves the body through the anus
solid waste material that leaves the body through the anus
very badly
a child’s word for the solid waste that is passed through the bowels
the raised part at the back end of a ship
a child’s word for the solid waste that is passed through the bowels
information about something, especially the most recent news
the act of getting rid of solid waste from your body through your bowels
